In Minecraft, arctic foxes should have unique behaviors compared to regular foxes. They should have the ability to turn water into ice by simply running or walking on it. Additionally, when they bite players or mobs, they can freeze them and deal extra damage to blazes. Players can make use of the arctic fox's speed and ice-making abilities by attaching a lead to it and then connecting the lead to a boat. As the fox pulls the boat, it leaves behind a trail of ice, enabling players to travel at incredible speeds on water. To direct the fox while on the boat, players need to hold a glow berry on a stick. However, this mode of transportation is exclusive to water and cannot be used on land.
This would be amazing
The boss sounds like a final boss...
Seems super fun I hope they add it.
You can spread the word if you want...it will help...
Mojang please add this...
This would be an awesome DLC, and the fact that we would get another boss with two phases...

I agree, but to balance it out, I think it should be a powerful enchantment. In addition, you should put it on the melee as well, but the first, second, and third hit does extra damage, depending on the enchantment level.

Also, that's the currently unimplemented Mason's job. To trade emeralds for diamond dust to upgrade your gear.

https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/article/new-dungeons-dlc-and-more-september-8

We’re also rolling out a free game update on September 8 that will include some fresh features: new merchants and Daily Trials. Save captured Merchants you encounter as you play the game and they’ll be so grateful that they’ll set up shop in your camp! The Blacksmith will upgrade items for you, and the Gift Wrapper will allow you to trade items with other players in multiplayer. The Merchants can also be levelled up for additional stock. The Daily Trials will provide fun new challenges every day! Daily Trials make wild changes to the game mechanics which provide difficult, experimental, or fun challenges for you to overcome.

Thanks for your feedback!

The Lightweight Feather does this
That's just making bows useless and not able to use. Maybe just some bosses could build up a better defense like enchantments or artifact abilitys like a moment it could be immune to arrows
Bows in general are currently to op. I think for starter they should just lower how much arrows you get.
I think there should a visual cue for that like Effect Bubbles from normal Minecraft for a shield like the Wither from normal Minecraft.

Great idea, and it seems legit, I mean currently with bows bosses are ridiculous, and I am a hundred percent sure that it would make the fight longers and with a real challenge! And it wouldn't even make bows useless as they got an extremely powerful room clearing power.
Maybe Just a phase where they become immune so accelerate wears off at least

Adding different long distance defense enchantments to the bosses would be the best option. Maybe add a few for melee as well, cause some bosses can be annihilated by a well made fast hammer build for example. Just do not make them annoying, just add them so that you have to consider your options, not be forced to switch play style mid fight just because the fight require you to. Arrows are also limited supply, so a boss can't be pure long distance for long either.

Reminds me, the ??? boss should not be so annoying in apocalypse you feel forced to fight with bow, as I did. It is challenging indeed, but there should in that one's case be something allowing you to get close as well. Final boss does not allow you to get too close as well a lot of the time.
No
No. Some people fail to understand that others just like to have fun and don't want a "real challenge".
I don't know if the range weapons are too strong or you just get kill too easily at melee range. You don't get enough chance to go melee (last boss or cauldron boss).
There should be some exceptions like the Redstone Monstrosity or the Corrupted Cauldron but otherwise I agree with you.
